ignore.old: method void org.mule.runtime.api.meta.model.parameter.ValueProviderModel::<init>(java.util.List<java.lang.String>, boolean, boolean, boolean, java.lang.Integer, java.lang.String)
ignore.new: method void org.mule.runtime.api.meta.model.parameter.ValueProviderModel::<init>(java.util.List<org.mule.runtime.api.meta.model.parameter.ActingParameterModel>, boolean, boolean, boolean, java.lang.Integer, java.lang.String, java.lang.String)
ignore.justification: Keeping the original constructor will breach the contract between actingParameters and parameters (which are an extended and augmented collection of actingParameters). The class is annotated with @NoInstantiate, so it allows us to remove that constructor without breaking backward compatibility.
